0.cdata!: Morocco - Second Projet de Developpement Sebou

abstracts.cdata!:
The project completion report (PCR) for
            the Second Sebou Irrigation Project in Morocco. Overall,
            second Sebou presents a mixed picture of achievements and
            failures. The Sebou National Sugarcane Factory Company
            (SUNACAS) sugarcane factory was built and started up on
            schedule and has made good progress in improving factory
            operations, largely as a result of a comprehensive and
            effective training program. However, the factory has
            experienced much lost time for lack of cane, caused by the
            combination of frost in 1976, lower-than-projected average
            sugarcane yields in all years, lagging efforts to improve
            the sugarcane harvesting-transport operations, and the
            start-up of sugar production at the nearby new Sucrerie
            raffinerie de canne du Gharb (SURAC) sugarcane factory in
            1981. As a result of these factors and an annually fixed
            sales price set too low by the Government, SUNACAS lost
            money in each of its first nine years of operation, and its
            financial structure became greatly weakened. Shortfalls in
            sugar production, caused mainly by inadequate supply of
            sugarcane, taken together with sharply reduced world sugar
            prices and a poor price outlook, have resulted in a
            recalculated economic rate of return (ERR) of 3.7 percent.
